name: Cherry and Coconut Brown Betty
recipeIngredient: 4 cups halved and pitted cherries (from about 1 1/2 pounds whole cherries)
2 cups fresh bread crumbs (preferably from brioche, challah or country bread)

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oven to 350 degrees. Butter an 8-inch-square baking dish. Spread 1 cup cherries in bottom of dish. Sprinkle with 2 tablespoons sugar, 2 tablespoons coconut and 1/2 cup bread crumbs. Repeat three more times with cherries and dry ingredients.
Cover baking dish with foil. Bake until cherry juice bubbles and candies a bit on the edges, about 1 hour. Remove foil and place dish under a broiler to toast the top layer, 1 to 3 minutes.
Serve warm; pass a pitcher of chilled cream at the table for drizzling on top.

video.name: Forget Pie or Cobbler: Call It a Sonker
video.description: The Times’s Kim Severson visits Mount Airy, N.C., to learn more about the sonker, a soupy baked fruit dessert native to Surry County.
